ret_001.query: What was the average income in Singapore in 2020?

expected_contexts.description: Gross Monthly Income From Employment of Full Time Employed Residents
expected_contexts.content: This dataset contains gross monthly income data from employment for full-time employed Singapore residents. Data is broken down by year and income percentiles, covering 1996 onwards. Source: Gross_Monthly_Income_From_Employment_of_Full_Time_Employed_Residents.csv

ret_002.query: Show me employment rates for 2019 and 2020

expected_contexts.description: Resident Employment Rate By Age and Sex
expected_contexts.content: Employment rate statistics for Singapore residents, covering employment rates across different age groups and sex. Contains 330 rows and covers years 1991 to 2023. Source: Resident_Employment_Rate_By_Age_and_Sex​​.csv

ret_003.query: Compare median income between males and females in 2021

expected_contexts.description: Gross Monthly Income From Employment of Full Time Employed Singapore Citizens
expected_contexts.content: Income statistics for full-time employed Singapore citizens, including income data disaggregated by year and percentile. Useful for analyzing income trends and distributions. Source: Gross_Monthly_Income_From_Employment_of_Full_Time_Employed_Singapore_Citizens.csv

ret_004.query: What are the working hours trends from 2018 to 2022?

expected_contexts.description: Annual Average Hours Worked Per Employed Person Aged Fifteen And Over By Industry
expected_contexts.content: This dataset contains annual average hours worked per employed person aged fifteen and over, broken down by industry. Covers the period from 2017 to 2022. Useful for analyzing working hours trends over time and across different industries. Source: annual_average_Hours_Worked_Per_Employed_Person_Aged_Fifteen_And_Over_By_Industry.csv

ret_005.query: Show unemployment rate by age group in 2020

expected_contexts.description: Resident Employment Rate By Age and Sex
expected_contexts.content: Employment rate statistics for Singapore residents, covering employment rates across different age groups and sex. Contains 330 rows and covers years 1991 to 2023. Can be used to derive unemployment trends by analyzing employment rate changes. Source: Resident_Employment_Rate_By_Age_and_Sex​​.csv
